column4: Hi all, I want to create a partition on my hard-disk (somehting like 40 GB / 500GB) to install windows on. I've never used gparted before and I see that /dev/sda1 is my main partition. I can't do anything unless I unmount it. Is this safe to do(unmounting your main partition)?
it's not really possible. you need to boot a live-cd
I don't know that the windows installer offers anything to create a partition...as far as I know it doesn't
you can make a live-usb/cd boot from it and do what you want with gparted
are you saying to create a gparted live cd/usb?
no. the ubuntu live-cd has gparted on it
so use the ubuntu-livecd to create a partition. then abort the installation and put in the windows-usb?
there is no installation if you just boot a live-cd just use gparted then shut it down
use the option on the menu like " try ubuntu with out installing "
thank you i will try that
i have an old ubuntu 7.07 cd. Will that suffice?
